oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hill's Chapel AME Church: front and side view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hill's Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Church

Color photograph of concrete-block, double gabled church. The vestibule contains double doors. Shingles comprise the top half of the entrance's facade and the main building's facade. Exterior side contains four windows and a chimney. Church sits in a rural area and is in poorly maintained condition.

Hill's Chapel AME Church dates from at least the 1920s. Rev. Robert Gardner served as the pastor in 1980. At the time of fieldwork, the church building was in a state of disrepair and no longer utilized as a meeting space.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee;
gable roofs; concrete;
